subclusters.subcluster_name: NADPH Oxidase-Derived ROS Free Radical Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction and ROS production as central to aging, highlighting mitochondrial permeability and energy decline.
Emphasizes mitochondrial energy decline, iron dysregulation, and ROS feedback loops driving brain aging.
Highlights selective oxidative damage to mitochondrial proteins and metabolic rate linkage to ROS and aging.
Details ROS generation in mitochondria, positional effects on mtDNA damage, and limitations of antioxidant defenses.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS as primary source of oxidative damage and its role in aging and metabolic rate.
Describes mitochondria as both source and target of ROS, linking mitochondrial oxidative damage to aging.
Classic free radical theory emphasizing mitochondrial ROS production and antioxidant defenses affecting lifespan.
Focuses on ROS as metabolic byproducts causing oxidative damage leading to aging, with mitochondria as main source.
Links mitochondrial ROS production to oxidative damage accumulation and lifespan modulation.
Emphasizes ROS accumulation from metabolism, antioxidant enzyme roles, and oxidative damage driving aging.
Proposes aging from oxidative damage accumulation due to imbalance between mitochondrial ROS and antioxidants.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS as causative agents of aging and dietary restriction modulating oxidative stress.
Classic free radical theory emphasizing oxidative damage accumulation from mitochondrial ROS and antioxidant insufficiency.
Describes free radical accumulation causing oxidative damage and aging, with mitochondrial ROS as key source.
Links ROS accumulation from mitochondria to oxidative damage and aging, with antioxidant interventions extending lifespan.
Discusses oxidative damage from mitochondrial ROS and balance with repair mechanisms influencing aging.
Historical overview emphasizing metabolic origin of free radicals, mainly mitochondrial, causing aging.
Focuses on ROS-induced damage from mitochondrial metabolism and antioxidant enzyme roles in aging.
Posits aging from accumulation of mitochondrial ROS-induced oxidative damage impairing physiological functions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: NADPH Oxidase-Derived ROS Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on NADPH oxidases as regulated sources of ROS contributing to oxidative damage and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: NADPH Oxidase-Derived ROS Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes ROS from NADPH oxidases, especially NoxO1, as contributors to oxidative damage and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thioredoxin Regulation of Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on TXNIP regulation of thioredoxin antioxidant system affecting ROS levels, DNA damage, and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Glutathione Deficiency and Redox Imbalance Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights glutathione decline impairing redox balance and increasing oxidative damage leading to aging.
Links oxidative damage specifically to frailty syndrome rather than chronological aging or lifespan.
Emphasizes oxidative stress association with frailty and unsuccessful aging distinct from lifespan effects.
Describes oxidative stress imbalance causing cellular senescence and frailty-related aging phenotypes.
Focuses on ROS/RNS-induced neuronal damage contributing to brain aging and frailty-related cognitive decline.
Updates free radical theory to include oxidants as signaling molecules driving cellular senescence and aging.
Focuses on reactive nitrogen species (RNS) and their signaling roles in seed aging and oxidative stress balance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Localized Free Radical Production and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes that free radical production near critical DNA targets determines lifespan via localized oxidative damage.
Classic theory emphasizing oxidative damage accumulation to macromolecules from mitochondrial ROS causing aging.
